intro: Panicum ninoleense, commonly known as Nīnole grass, is a perennial grass native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, two-lobed flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is often found in native habitats and coastal areas.
